# Important Character Creation Tips This guide covers the parts of character creation that affect gameplay in this gamemode. (Cosmetic changes are unchanged and are not included here.)
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Spawn Priority Spawn options determine where you appear **when joining an ongoing round**.
- **Cryosleep**: You awaken inside the station’s cryosleep chamber. - **None**: Automatically selects whichever spawn option is valid for the map.
The **Arrivals shuttle system does not exist** in this gamemode, so only station-based spawns are used. This setting is mostly preference and can safely be left on “None.”
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Jobs In the lobby you may set job preferences. These determine which roles the system considers you for when the round begins.
Priority works as follows: - High priority jobs are rolled first - Then medium priority - Then low priority
If you are not selected for any preferred role, you may choose to: - Spawn as a passenger - Or return to the lobby to wait for the next round
Some jobs remain locked until you gain enough playtime in accessible entry-level roles.
[textlink="Learn more about jobs here." link="Jobs"]
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Job Loadouts Each job allows you to select a **loadout** of clothing or minor equipment. Loadout items may affect gameplay:
- Some clothing provides **armor protection** - Some items may **slow your movement speed** - Higher-responsibility roles (Engineering, Cargo, Medical, etc.) may feel these effects more strongly
You can also select your **bag type**: - [color=#a4885c]Backpacks[/color]: Medium capacity, easier to store large items - [color=#a4885c]Satchels[/color]: Highest total storage, worst for carrying large items - [color=#a4885c]Duffel Bags[/color]: Largest capacity but incur a movement penalty
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Traits
### Speech Traits These modify how your text appears in chat. Some are mild, while others drastically change speech patterns.
Options include: - Accentless - Social anxiety (stutter) - Southern drawl - Pirate accent - Cowboy accent - Italian accent - Frontal lisp - Pathological liar
It is recommended to master normal communication or mild accents before selecting strong or comedic accents.
### Disability Traits These introduce gameplay challenges. Beginners should avoid them until familiar with the game loop and station environment.
- Blindness - Muted (cannot speak; use emotes or pen-and-paper) - Short-sighted - Narcolepsy - Pacifist - Paracusia (auditory hallucinations) - Lightweight drunk - Snoring - Unrevivable (cannot be resuscitated)
Choose these only if you understand the difficulty they add to your play experience.
